metadata.title: CVE-2017-14054 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In libavformat/rmdec.c in FFmpeg 3.3.3, a DoS in ivr_read_header() due tolack of an EOF (End of File) check might cause huge CPU consumption. When acrafted IVR file, which claims a large "len" field in the header but doesnot contain sufficient backing data, is provided, the first type==4 loopwould consume huge CPU resources, since there is no EOF check inside theloop.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.3.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.3.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.3.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.3.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.3.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.3.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.3.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.3.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.3.4-1').
